gw.api.webservice.tableImport

Interface ITableImportAPI

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    TableImportImpl

    public interface ITableImportAPI
    This interface provides methods for integrity checking and loading data via the staging tables.

    In particular, it allows the caller to instruct the server to perform the following staging table operations:

    1. Clear error table.
    2. Clear exclusion table.
    3. Clear staging tables.
    4. Delete rows from staging tables based on contents of exclusion table.
    5. Populate exclusion table with rows to be excluded.
    6. Integrity check the contents of the staging tables.
    7. Integrity check the contents of the staging tables and load source tables if no errors.
    8. List the available Load History reports.

      • deleteExcludedRowsFromStagingTablesAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID deleteExcludedRowsFromStagingTablesAsBatchProcess()
                                                     throws SOAPException,
                                                            PermissionException
        Instructs the server to delete rows from staging tables based on the contents of the exclusion table (delete all rows in all staging tables where the LUWID matches a LUWID in the exclusion table.)

        The same as deleteExcludedRowsFromStagingTables except that the operation is done asynchronously in a batch process. Note that this batch process can't be terminated.

        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to retrieve the status of the job
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • populateExclusionTable

        @Deprecated
void populateExclusionTable()
                                 throws SOAPException,
                                        PermissionException
        Deprecated. 
        Instructs the server to populate the exclusion table with rows to be excluded (add rows to the exclusion table for every unique LUWID in the load error tables that is not already in the exclusion table).
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • populateExclusionTableAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID populateExclusionTableAsBatchProcess()
                                        throws SOAPException,
                                               PermissionException
        Instructs the server to populate the exclusion table with rows to be excluded (add rows to the exclusion table for every unique LUWID in the error tables that is not already in the exclusion table).

        The same as deleteExcludedRowsFromStagingTables except that the operation is done asynchronously in a batch process. Note that this batch process can't be terminated.

        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to retrieve the status of the job
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • updateStatisticsOnStagingTables

        @Deprecated
void updateStatisticsOnStagingTables()
                                          throws SOAPException
        Deprecated. 
        Instructs the server to update the database statistics on the staging tables. (Database statistics will not be updated on the other tables.)
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • updateStatisticsOnStagingTablesAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID updateStatisticsOnStagingTablesAsBatchProcess()
                                                 throws SOAPException
        Instructs the server to update the database statistics on the staging tables. (Database statistics will not be updated on the other tables.) The same as updateStatisticsOnStagingTables except that the process will be performed asynchronously in a batch process. After completion, the process status will contain the number of tables that were updated in the opsCompleted field. Note that this batch process can't be terminated.
        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to retrieve the status of the job
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • integrityCheckStagingTableContents

        @Deprecated
TableImportResult integrityCheckStagingTableContents(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                                 java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                                 java.lang.Boolean allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows,
                                                                 java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                          throws SOAPException,
                                                                 PermissionException
        Deprecated. 
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the load error tables.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly exlcuded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows - If true, rows in the staging tables are allowed to reference existing rows in any table, regardless of whether or not the tables are admin tables.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a TableImportResult object containing load error information and any raised exception.
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAsBatchProcess(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                           java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                           java.lang.Boolean allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows,
                                                           java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                    throws SOAPException,
                                                           PermissionException
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the load error tables. Works like integrityCheckStagingTableContents, but does so in a batch process. After completion, the process status will indicate whether or not the load succeeded, and the failedOps field will contain the number of integrity check errors that occurred (if any). Note that this batch process can't be terminated.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly exlcuded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows - If true, rows in the staging tables are allowed to reference existing rows in any table, regardless of whether or not the tables are admin tables.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to retrieve the status of the job
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTables

        @Deprecated
TableImportResult integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTables(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                                                    java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                                                    java.lang.Boolean updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates,
                                                                                    java.lang.Boolean allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows,
                                                                                    java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                                             throws SOAPException,
                                                                                    PermissionException
        Deprecated. 
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the error tables. If no integrity check errors are detected, the server will load the source tables (the main application tables) with the contents of the staging tables.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly exlcuded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates - If true, then update the database statistics on any table that will be loaded with estimated changes based on the contents of the associated staging table. When loading large amounts of data which will cause a source table to grow significantly, the optimizer could choose a bad query plan based on the existing state of the database statistics unless the loader updates the database statistics to reflect the expected size of the table after the load has completed. This parameter is only meaningful when running against Oracle.
        allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows - If true, rows in the staging tables are allowed to reference existing rows in any table, regardless of whether or not the tables are admin tables.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a TableImportResult object containing load error information and any raised exception.
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • integrityCheckZoneStagingTableContentsAndLoadZoneSourceTables

        @Deprecated
TableImportResult integrityCheckZoneStagingTableContentsAndLoadZoneSourceTables(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                                                            java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                                                            java.lang.Boolean updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates,
                                                                                            java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                                                     throws SOAPException,
                                                                                            PermissionException
        Deprecated. 
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the Zone staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the error tables. If no integrity check errors are detected, the server will load the source tables (the main application tables) with the contents of the staging tables.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly excluded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates - If true, then update the database statistics on any table that will be loaded with estimated changes based on the contents of the associated staging table. When loading large amounts of data which will cause a source table to grow significantly, the optimizer could choose a bad query plan based on the existing state of the database statistics unless the loader updates the database statistics to reflect the expected size of the table after the load has completed. This parameter is only meaningful when running against Oracle.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a TableImportResult object containing load error information and any raised exception.
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTablesAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID integrityCheckStagingTableContentsAndLoadSourceTablesAsBatchProcess(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                                              java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                                              java.lang.Boolean updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates,
                                                                              java.lang.Boolean allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows,
                                                                              java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                                       throws SOAPException,
                                                                              PermissionException
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the load error tables. If no integrity check errors are detected, the server will load the source tables (the main application tables) with the contents of the staging tables. This method does the load asynchronously via the batch process mechanism, and the process ID that is returned can be used to query the status of the load and find out if it succeeded or failed (or is still running). After completion, the process status will indicate whether or not the load succeeded, the failedOps field will contain the number of validation errors that occurred (if any), and the return value field will contain the PublicID of the LoadCommand executed. Note that this batch process can't be terminated.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly exlcuded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates - If true, then update the database statistics on any table that will be loaded with estimated changes based on the contents of the associated staging table. When loading large amounts of data which will cause a source table to grow significantly, the optimizer could choose a bad query plan based on the existing state of the database statistics unless the loader updates the database statistics to reflect the expected size of the table after the load has completed. This parameter is only meaningful when running against Oracle.
        allowRefsToExistingNonAdminRows - If true, rows in the staging tables are allowed to reference existing rows in any table, regardless of whether or not the tables are admin tables.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to query the status of the running load
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • integrityCheckZoneStagingTableContentsAndLoadZoneSourceTablesAsBatchProcess

        ProcessID integrityCheckZoneStagingTableContentsAndLoadZoneSourceTablesAsBatchProcess(java.lang.Boolean clearErrorTable,
                                                                                      java.lang.Boolean populateExclusionTable,
                                                                                      java.lang.Boolean updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates,
                                                                                      java.lang.Integer numThreadsIntegrityChecking)
                                                                               throws SOAPException,
                                                                                      PermissionException
        Instructs the server to check the integrity of the contents of the Zone staging tables, inserting details about any failures into the error tables. If no integrity check errors are detected, the server will load the source tables (the main application tables) with the contents of the staging tables. After completion, the process status will indicate whether or not the load succeeded, the failedOps field will contain the number of validation errors that occurred (if any), and the return value field will contain the PublicID of the LoadCommand executed. Note that this batch process can't be terminated.
        Parameters:
        clearErrorTable - If true, the load error tables will be cleared before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        populateExclusionTable - If true, populate exclusion table with any newly excluded rows before executing integrity checking (defaults to true if this parameter is null).
        updateDBStatisticsWithEstimates - If true, then update the database statistics on any table that will be loaded with estimated changes based on the contents of the associated staging table. When loading large amounts of data which will cause a source table to grow significantly, the optimizer could choose a bad query plan based on the existing state of the database statistics unless the loader updates the database statistics to reflect the expected size of the table after the load has completed. This parameter is only meaningful when running against Oracle.
        numThreadsIntegrityChecking - If greater than 1, multithread integrity checking with the configured number of threads.
        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to query the status of the running load
        Throws:
        SOAPException
        PermissionException

      • encryptDataOnStagingTables

        int encryptDataOnStagingTables()
                        throws SOAPException
        Deprecated. 
        Encrypt columns configured to be encrypted in the staging tables
        Returns:
        The number of staging tables whose columns were encrypted
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • encryptDataOnStagingTablesAsBatchProcess

                                            throws SOAPException
        Encrypt columns configured to be encrypted in the staging tables
        Returns:
        a ProcessID that can be used to query the status of the running load
        Throws:
        SOAPException

      • getLoadHistoryDownloadsInfo

        java.lang.String[] getLoadHistoryDownloadsInfo(int numDownloads)
                                        throws ServerStateException
        Return Load History downloads information.
        Parameters:
        numDownloads - number of most recent Load History downloads information to return. Zero means all
        Returns:
        requested Load History downloads information as a string
        Throws:
        ServerStateException

      • getLoadHistoryReport

        byte[] getLoadHistoryReport(java.lang.String reportPublicId)
                     throws ServerStateException
        Return Load History Report with given public ID. The report is returned as an array of bytes to be saved as a zip file
        Parameters:
        reportPublicId - public ID of requested Load History Report
        Returns:
        requested Load History Report as a byte array
        Throws:
        ServerStateException
